message.content:
This haiku beautifully captures the essence of computer programming:

"Lines of logic flow" refers to the code that programmers write, which follows logical patterns and structures.

"Syntax dances on the screen" evokes the visual aspect of coding, where programming languages have their own syntax rules that create a sort of rhythm or dance as they appear on the computer screen.

"Bugs hide in shadows" alludes to the common experience of errors or "bugs" in code that are not immediately apparent. These bugs can be elusive, hiding in the metaphorical shadows of the program, waiting to be discovered and fixed.

Together, these lines paint a picture of the programming process: the creation of logical structures, the visual and almost artistic aspect of writing code, and the challenge of finding and fixing errors that inevitably occur in complex systems.
